data.title: Delicious food with great atmosphere
data.text: Our group of 10 tried every meat and side option and we each loved every item!  You can mix and match several chicken and meat oprions in sandwiches or meals with unlimited home cooked style sides. I had chicken, brisket and pulled pork while other in our group had ribs.  Eceptional sides.  Family friendly staff and rustic facility added to the charm. Highly recommend!

data.title: Generous & Tasty Servings
data.text: These folks have great BBQ, and the side dishes are all you want. Just get there before 12:00 if you want the cobbler. Once it's gone there is no more that day!

data.title: Hoegemeyer's BBQ Barn is the place to go!
data.text: Hoegemeyer's BBQ Barn is exactly what you think when you think of a Texas Roadhouse.  The atmosphere is awesome and the food was even better.  The smoked chicken is mouth watering goodness.  It literally falls of the bone cooked to perfection.  You can get all you can eat sides and I recommend the black-eyed peas for sure.

data.title: Great Atmosphere - Even Better Food!
data.text:
We were in town for a conference and since this place was less than 5 minutes away from our meeting (and I had already seen it on google maps when I was mapping our route), I decided this would be our lunch spot. I'm glad I picked it!

Obviously, it's a favorite for locals, because most of the people in there were blue-collar types who worked in the refineries around the area. I had a "Texas Philly Cheesesteak" (a cheesesteak sandwich made with brisket - fantastic). My business partner had a BBQ sandwich, which she demolished (the buns are baked fresh on-site every morning). 

They call your name to come get your order and then load you up with side dishes and peach cobbler. You can get more sides if you want - just come back up and ask. They even put an extra helping of potato salad in my to-go box! 

The food is excellent and the place was packed on a Tuesday afternoon. It's family owned and the atmosphere is relaxed with thrift-store kitsch attached to the walls inside a huge, barn-like building. 

Go. Eat. You'll be glad you did.

data.title: Texas BBQ at it's best
data.text: If you like BBQ then you must come to Hoegemeyer's Barbeque Barn. I have gone to many BBQ places in Corpus Christi and this one is by far the best. They are only open for lunch so if you are wanting to go there don't make dinner plans to go. When you make BBQ this good you can afford to be open 4 hours a day. I had the Texas Reuben Sandwich which has slow smoked brisket on it instead of corned beef. Unlike many BBQ joints in town, Hoegemeyer's piled the meat high on this sandwich. It was absolutely delicious. My friend had the Texas Cheese Steak which was equally stuffed with meat. They have many options here to choose from. You can order a one, two, or three meat plate, sandwiches (which they call Samiches), sausage, chicken, ribs, etc. When you pick up your order they ask you which sides you would like. I had Texas Potato salad, Coleslaw, Baked Beans, and Peach Cobbler. Every side was very tasty. This place has a real country feel about it and has the look of a barn with antique items everywhere. If you leave here don't leave here full then you just did not eat. Anytime I am downtown during the week I will eat lunch here. Excellent.

data.title: Great meat!
data.text: Took whole family and everyone (kids included) were pleased.  Wife enjoyed the Reuben (yes, at a BBQ place) and I had a two-meat plate with spicy sausage (aka. jalapeno sausage) and pork ribs - both of which excellent in flavor, bark (ribs), texture (tender) and portion size (ample.)  I also tried both of the potato salads and they were equally excellent, as was the cole slaw.  If you like BBQ, you'll like this place!

data.title: Great food, people and atmosphere
data.text: Brisket and sauce was awesome!!! Super nice people and eclectic fun family atmosphere. Great place for Texas barbeque.

data.title: Great environment and great food
data.text: We had a great experience from the moment we walked in. I had a pulled pork sammich and the BBQ beans...yum! I definitely suggest this place!

data.title: Amazing BBQ
data.text: The only reason I might come back to Corpus Christi & the cute little state of Texas. (Hey I'm from Alaska, everything is smaller by comparison where ever I go) Truly the highlight of my trip. I traveled over 2800 miles to see a rock concert & they cancelled. That would've been the icing on the cake but I didn't let it ruin my trip. Hoegemeyer's has to be what Texas BBQ is all about. Had some ribs, brisket, two all you can eat sides & peach cobbler that is also good enough to come back for by itself.

data.title: Okay for Corpus Christi, but really just average for Texas BBQ
data.text:
The atmosphere is comfortable and appropriate for BBQ, and the folks running the place are great.  However, the food itself doesn't really rise above or below Corpus Christi's rather unimpressive BBQ scene.  

The highlights of the meal were the tender brisket and spare ribs, which were pretty darn good.  The sausage, BBQ sauce and sides were all at or below par.

If you are looking for a change up from BBQ Man, Mr. G's or Miller Barbecue (NOTE: Bill Miller, Silverado and most others aren't even mediocre and don't warrant mention), Hoegemeyer's is a good choice.  If you are thinking you are getting Lockhart, Luling or Austin BBQ, you won't find it here or any other place in Corpus Christi.

data.title: great barbecue
data.text: very good food. the place is very comfortable. we carpooled due to limited parking. took 17 people and everyone was pleased. the employees were very nice and the place was clean

data.title: Very very good meals!
data.text: Delicious meats and unlimited sides. Family run by the nicest of folks. Get there early or you might miss some of the meat options.

data.title: Amazing bbq and service!
data.text: can't rave enough about this place. BBQ was great, the service was great, the whole experience was great. The owner accommodated our large family after the loss of our mother and just made us all feel at home. And that in itself was wonderful, but then the BBQ, and I have had a lot of good BBQ in my life--from the South to the North--and this was the best! A great find. Can't wait to go back next time in Texas!!

data.title: A bit of a walk from the courthouse
data.text: If you are in Corpus Christi for the day for an appearance at the courthouse, and you have some time on your hands, walk on over.  I was there early, and there was no line.  But, it filled up around noon.  The staff was very friendly.  And be sure to browse the antiques, too.

data.title: Texas Reuben-huge delight!
data.text: Stopped here after golf, luckily after the lunch crowd was gone. One of the specials was the Texas Reuben and we both chose to try it. Homemade sauerkraut and sauce, Swiss cheese, slices of tender brisket an inch high, all on grilled rye bread. I had Baked Tater Salad, made with sour cream-mmmm! Hubby had regular Thayer salad and baked beans. Both to his liking. The kicker is-cobbler comes with the meal. Topped with whipped cream-great finish to a wonderful meal. I want to go back to try the ribs. Only open Mon-Fri from 11-3, so try to avoid the lunchtime crowds. Don't miss this place-you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great BBQ at Reasonable Prices
data.text: Hoegemeyer's may not be the easiest to find unless you are on your way to a Hooks baseball game, but their barbecue is very tasty, prices are good, and they offer free refills on side dishes.  Get there early so you can get a dish of the daily cobbler; when it's gone there is no more until the next day!!  Brisket (lean or fatty), sausage, ribs (pork or beef) -- you name it!

data.title: If you like BBQ
data.text: I eat at Hoegemeyer's BBQ every couple of weeks because I love their BBQ sausage and brisket.  It is conveniently located downtown Corpus Christi.

data.title: Country place and antiques
data.text: The atmosphere is country, with an antique store on one side.  The food is simply delicious,  The best barbecue I've ever eaten!  There is a vegetable bar that is all you can eat, as well as, cobbler to die for.

data.title: Great food and hosts
data.text: We showed up for a very late lunch just as they were closing for the day but the owners graciously let us in warning that they could not offer us a full menu. We had a nice chat about Germany (my hubby is German) and they recommended that we visit Fredericksburg (which we did). The pulled pork and sides were delicious. It was quiet in there so we had a good chance to take in the eclectic décor. We highly recommend this place!

data.title: Excellent BBQ
data.text: This was very good BBQ.   We sampled the Beef Ribs, Pork Ribs, Sausage and Brisket.  All very good and included are the all you can eat sides such as cole slaw, Potato salad, beans, okra, etc.    Also included is Fruit Cobbler.  Good Food and Good prices.  They are only open weekdays from 11 am to 3 pm.  Give it a try.  We will be back !
